sand-dirt.name: Sand, Fill Dirt, Pea Gravel
sand-dirt.description: Fill Sand: Great for general fill, leveling low spots, and base layers. Inexpensive option for large fill projects. Fill Dirt: Perfect for filling holes, low areas, or general landscaping projects. Contains natural topsoil content. Pea Gravel: Decorative and comfortable for walking areas. Good for landscaping, pathways, and decorative applications.

topsoil.name: Shredded and Unshredded Topsoil
topsoil.description: Shredded Topsoil: Ready-to-use for lawns, gardens, and landscaping. Fine, uniform texture for easy spreading and seeding. Unshredded Topsoil: More economical option with natural chunks. Great for bulk fill under lawns or in landscape beds. Both types are nutrient-rich and perfect for establishing new grass or garden areas.

hard-rock-gravel.name: Hard Rock (3/4" - 1") & 3/8" Chip Gravel
hard-rock-gravel.description: 3/4" to 1" Hard Rock: Ideal for driveway and parking lot surfaces. Compacts well for a solid, stable driving surface. Excellent durability. 3/8" Chip Gravel: Great drainage material and decorative option. Works well as a top layer or for landscaping projects. Better for areas needing drainage. Both materials compact and lock together for superior road stability.

limestone.name: Limestone (1 1/2" - 1 1/4") Gravel
limestone.description: 1 1/2" Limestone: Excellent for driveway bases and heavy-traffic areas. Compacts firmly and provides superior stability. 1 1/4" Limestone: Slightly smaller size for more uniform appearance. Great for both base layers and top-layer finishing. Limestone naturally binds together when compacted, creating a solid, long-lasting surface. Superior to plain rock for load-bearing applications.

kge-base.name: KGE & AB3 Base
kge-base.description: KGE Base (Crusher Rock - 1 1/4"): Ideal for driveways, parking areas, camper pads, and filling potholes. Typically used as a base layer only. AB-3 Base (1 1/2"): Consider surfacing with 3/4" Hard Rock if using for driveway or parking applications. Do not use AB-3 in areas that are already wet or muddy, as it can take time for the material to dry out and stabilize.
